name: the online discussion room
postTitle: Artificial Intelligence in healthcare - what do you think?

comments.content: I worked in an ER and cant think of any situation where AI would have helped a patient

replies.content: I can't imagine it being that useful in its current stage for immediate issues, but I can see it being good for analyzing a patient's health and data over a long period of time to find issues.
That's good to know.  I appreciate having the opinion of someone in that's worked in an area that we are discussing

comments.content: I think it may have it's uses in the future but it shouldn't be the only option.  That a real human doctor should always have the final say

AI is good for early analysis of a person's symptoms and health status, but every person's case is different so it could be good as a tool to help make doctors and nurses more efficient, but not for the actual decisions regarding a person's care which should always be made by the doctors and their patients together.
